src:
Ponoči bodo Slovenijo zajele obilnejše padavine
04 Nov 2019, 16:15 by STA

Slovenijo bodo ponoči in v torek zajele obilnejše padavine z nalivi. V zahodnem, južnem in deloma osrednjem delu države bo predvidoma padlo od 50 do okoli 100, drugod pa od 20 do okoli 50 litrov dežja na kvadratni meter. Agencija RS za okolje je za zahodni in osrednji del države izdala oranžno opozorilo. Dež bo ponehal v torek zvečer.



Foto: Leo Caharija

LJUBLJANA > Po podatkih agencije za okolje se Sloveniji v noči na torek bliža druga fronta, zato se bo jugozahodnik krepil, z njim pa tudi dotok toplega in vlažnega zraka. Zahodni del države bodo že v prvem delu noči zajele nove padavine, ki se bodo počasi širile tudi nad osrednjo in južno Slovenijo. Torek bo tako že od jutra oblačen s pogostimi padavinami, vmes bodo tudi nevihte z nalivi.
V večjem delu države bodo torkove najvišje dnevne temperature od 13 do 17, na Primorskem okoli 20 stopinj Celzija.
Zaradi obilnejših padavin bodo v torek zjutraj reke po Sloveniji začele naraščati in čez dan dosegle velike pretoke. Največje pretoke bodo dosegle v večernih urah in v noči na sredo. Ob tem lahko pride do razlivanj posameznih vodotokov. Gladina morja bo v torek ob jutranji plimi povišana.
V sredo bo prevladovalo oblačno vreme, tudi nekaj sonca bo. Predvsem v zahodni in osrednji Sloveniji bo občasno rahlo deževalo. V drugi polovici tedna pričakujemo še dve fronti, ki bosta poleg padavin prinesli tudi nekoliko nižje temperature.
text:
At night, Slovenia will be covered with heavy rainfall
04 Nov 2019, 15:15 by STA

Slovenia will be covered by heavy rainfall at night and Tuesday. In the western, southern and partly central parts of the country, it is expected to fall from 50 to about 100, and elsewhere from 20 to about 50 liters of rain per square meter. The Environmental Agency of the RS issued an orange warning for the western and central parts of the country. The rain will end on Tuesday night.



Photo by Leo Cahari

LJUBLJANA> According to the Environmental Agency, another front is approaching Slovenia on Tuesday night, so the southwest will strengthen, as well as the flow of warm and humid air. The western part of the country will already receive new rainfall in the first part of the night, which will slowly spread over central and southern Slovenia. Tuesday will be cloudy with frequent rainfall this morning, with storms in the afternoon.
In most parts of the country, there will be a maximum daily temperature of 13 to 17 on Tuesday, around 20 degrees Celsius in the Littoral.
Due to heavy rainfall, rivers across Slovenia will start rising on Tuesday morning and reach high flows during the day. They will reach maximum flows in the evening and on Wednesday nights. This may result in spills of individual watercourses. The sea level will rise on Tuesday at high tide.
Wednesday will be dominated by cloudy weather, with some sunshine as well. Mostly in western and central Slovenia it will occasionally rain slightly. Two more fronts are expected in the second half of the week, which will bring slightly lower temperatures besides precipitation.
